urls.title: The Chilterns AONB - News
urls.description: Buckinghamshire Council and the Chilterns Conservation Board have serious concerns about the impacts of HS2‚Äôs tunnelling operations on Buckinghamshire‚Äôs aquifer and chalk streams. These concerns relate to pollution resulting from tunnelling operations, increasing abstraction of water and impacts on the flow of significant chalk streams, such as the River Misbourne. A joint Position Statement has been issued with a series of questions regarding these concerns, and the Council and the Chilterns Conservation

tweets.text:
Here is a good statement reflecting our concerns with regard to HS2 Tunnelling and the impact on the chalk aquifer https://t.co/tUIdNMbtSW
It is with sadness we announce a very compliant @EnvAgency have approved the tunnelling without any public consultation.

@DouglasPilot @Greenstreet @CRTNorthWest @stormwater_jo @GroundworkCLM @Mike_Forty @Bithells @WiganCouncil @Wingate_Wood @EnvAgencyNW @WigToday @VitaminSNC Great to actually get the job done https://t.co/iBRBiNnkoD

Today our River @GreenStreet #wigan is clear of years of plastic waste after top team work & ¬£ donations. TEAM DOUGLAS are the fab @CRTNorthWest @stormwater_jo @GroundworkCLM @River_Douglas_ @Mike_Forty @Bithells @WiganCouncil @Wingate_Wood @EnvAgencyNW + RAM Safety RT @WigToday https://t.co/y3tXJEsYV0

@writethewrongs2 @Rosemar67378666 @EnvAgency @GreenJennyJones @CarolineLucas @ZacGoldsmith The environment agency is not fit for purpose and hasn't been for years..chucking sewage in our rivers and now turning green space into eyesores, supporting destruction of the environment instead of protecting it!!

tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids The odour has gotten worse since the capping took place. I didn't think it was possible for it to get worse but sadly I was wrong. I'm breathing in H2S while typing this tweet, as the noxious gas has pervaded my home again. More sleep deprivation & stress for many in NUL tonight.

@EnvAgencyMids I‚Äôve just come out of hospital after spending 9 days in there and the stink in my home is unbearable, I‚Äôm struggling to breathe and my throat is burning. When are you going to do your job and close the site

@EnvAgencyMids Can't even hide in bed, it's in there, Bathroom it's in there, hallway is unbearable, kitchen it's there, living room it's there. Surprise me and do something, like your job, make our environment safe.
@EnvAgencyMids Stinks here today so bad and we are over 5 miles away. Ridiculous

#wednesdaythought is it not illegal to put tyres in landfill @RedIndustries2 please look into this @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA @DefraGovUK #StopTheStink #CloseItDown @StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off @SimonTagg @AaronBell4NUL https://t.co/QwG198A8My

UPDATE - After the appeal we put out last night to @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @kiergroup & @NESouthWest there was no nest destruction today at the River Otter Restoration Project in Devon and the partners are reconsidering their plans - thank you . Top work @WiseBirding et al . https://t.co/A8KSk5gcuE
We wrote a blog for @WCL_News to share findings of our report on the role of the @EnvAgency in protecting #rivers, lakes and streams in England üëáüíß https://t.co/6rXAJbLYjW

urls.title: Is the Environment Agency doing its job?
urls.description: Guy Linley-Adams, Solicitor to Salmon & Trout Conservation, shares the findings from their new report on the role of the Environment Agency & why greater investment is needed to make our rivers, lakes, and streams healthy by 2027.

tweets.text: 1/2: As @EnvAgency turns 25, Guy Linley-Adams of @SalmonTroutCons asks "is the Environment Agency doing its job?" via @wcl_news https://t.co/IT3e9npkLT
